newsitem.title: CHILE: Exxon plans Chile copper mine expansion.
newsitem.headline: Exxon plans Chile copper mine expansion.

text.p: Exxon Minerals plans to invest $570 million in a project to double the production capacity of its Los Bronces copper mine, said Chilean government gazette Diario Oficial.
The project involves expanding the mine's processing capacity to 75,000 tonnes of mineral a day from current capacity of 37,000 tonnes of mineral, said the statement.
The expansion will be completed by 2000, it said.
Los Bronces, which lies in the Andes close to Santiago, currently produces 130,000 tonnes of copper in concentrates a year.
Compaa Minera Disputada de las Condes, which operates Los Bronces, has submitted the environment impact study for the project to Chile's environment authorities for approval, it said.
Disputada also operates the El Soldado copper mine in Chile which produces around 70,000 tonnes of copper a year.
